figgy.title: Can't set activejobs to :inline in development
Enable CDL workflow for EAD objects

comments.body:
## Possible Implementation Options

1. A new visibility setting along with a "CDL Concurrent Users" property
2. Just a "CDL Concurrent Users" property, along with a note that it will only apply if it's not a voyager item
3. Store the number of concurrent licenses in the EAD somehow.

@kelynch To clarify, this isn't per item, but per collection? Is it per "Figgy Collection", or per EAD? If it's per Figgy collection, what happens if an item is a member of two collections? Is it one concurrent checkout per collection it's part of?
This is per EAD collection.  We may also be able to make the number of seats available be global across all EAD. @escowles is checking with stakeholders.

pulfalight.title: Ensure that the resource request form is accessible
Ensure that the search component and advanced search forms are accessible
Ensure that the Table of Contents component is accessible
Ensure that the "ask a question" form is fully accessible
Ensure that the "suggest finding aid corrections" form is accessible
Integrate accessibility testing into the continuous integration workflow
Should we have a facet for undated material?
Ensure that PULFALight is WCAG 2.1 AA accessible

comments.body: This epic should ensure that the PULFALight interfaces meet the WCAG 2.1 criteria. As banners and alerts should be checked for color contrast in order to meet these criteria, a part of this process is going to be manual.
There already exists an accessibility audit template available at https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1g-J06sJHhY9XV1woIscElEHZEWHlJK9e8TzhO2uY1hk/edit#gid=1992549741
A usability testing script should be drafted in collaboration with @axamei and @sdellis in order to ensure that there is a reference for guiding users through the interfaces.
Regarding accessibility, it would be ideal if an unsighted person could be recruited for testing, and then could use only the keyboard for navigating the interfaces with a screen reader.
Please see the `usability_testing_script` in the shared Google Drive for an example usability testing script.

pulfalight.title: Define a process for managing releases

comments.body: Prior to this discussion, releases were based upon specific branches addressing individual GitHub issues. Branch-based deployment was undertaken into the staging environment where the proposed changes were tested and reviewed, followed by the opening of a pull request. When a pull request was merged into the `main` branch, the `main` branch would then be deployed to the staging environment.

One proposed alternative to this approach would be the usage of `tags` in order to track a potential release. A predetermined set of issues would be resolved by pull requests, merging commits into `main`, after which a `tag` would  then be created. This `tag` would then be deployed into the staging environment, and manually tested by following a defined quality assurance process.

Should this release candidate be pass the acceptance criteria defined for this QA process, then the `tag` would be deployed into the production environment.

Thus far, I have only been using GitHub Milestones in order to classify Issues which are scoped for the Minimum Viable Product (MVP) or 1.0 releases. Perhaps this would be an appropriate time to attempt to utilize GitHub releases instead of Milestones?

pulmap.title: Private layers are missing from the restricted-figgy Workspace for GeoServer

comments.body:
GeoServer keeps crashing with the following error message:

```
org.geowebcache.GeoWebCacheException: Problem communicating with GeoServer                                                                                                              [144/164]
        at org.geoserver.gwc.layer.GeoServerTileLayer.getMetatilingReponse(GeoServerTileLayer.java:611)
        at org.geoserver.gwc.layer.GeoServerTileLayer.getTile(GeoServerTileLayer.java:554)
        at org.geoserver.gwc.GWC.dispatch(GWC.java:718)
```

GeoWebCache is coupled by default with GeoServer, but it can also be used to deploy GeoServer in a clustered configuration. I'm afraid that I would need to diagnose the GeoWebCache configuration settings in order to further progress with this.

This does not seem to break after I attempted to view this in Brave after breaking the UI in Chrome:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88235421-d87cf180-cc48-11ea-9ca7-2bf7c0a74ef3.png)

Downloading the "Original Shapefile" seems to be working, as the Shapefile was valid when I downloaded this to my local macOS environment:

```
shapefile_rr172158w % ogrinfo -listmdd ./Global_3G_201612.shp
INFO: Open of `./Global_3G_201612.shp'
      using driver `ESRI Shapefile' successful.
1: Global_3G_201612 (Polygon)
shapefile_rr172158w % ogrinfo -al ./Global_3G_201612.shp | head -25
INFO: Open of `./Global_3G_201612.shp'
      using driver `ESRI Shapefile' successful.

Layer name: Global_3G_201612
Metadata:
  DBF_DATE_LAST_UPDATE=2017-02-22
Geometry: Polygon
Feature Count: 2412459
Extent: (-179.999989, -53.757229) - (179.999989, 78.383380)
Layer SRS WKT:
GEOGCS["WGS 84",
    DATUM["WGS_1984",
        SPHEROID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
            AUTHORITY["EPSG","7030"]],
        AUTHORITY["EPSG","6326"]],
    PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
        AUTHORITY["EPSG","8901"]],
    UNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433,
        AUTHORITY["EPSG","9122"]],
    AUTHORITY["EPSG","4326"]]
SOURCE: String (20.0)
CNTRY_COV: String (10.0)
CNTRY_CODE: Real (19.11)
COUNTRY: String (60.0)
CNTRY_ISO: Integer64 (10.0)
```

However, none of the derivatives could be downloaded for the file:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88236447-0cf1ad00-cc4b-11ea-8b81-c09be86da834.png)
Attempting to refresh the browser window led to various errors, and attempting to restart the GeoServer installation did not resolve the problems encountered for this record.

Attempting to view publicly accessible Documents published by Princeton, I am finding that Leaflet is breaking given that CORS headers are not provided for the WMS responses:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88237733-dd906f80-cc4d-11ea-8c12-16e1cb8b8edb.png)

GeoServer is now inaccessible:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88238247-25fc5d00-cc4f-11ea-9e93-06af523d8965.png)
Please note that I am accessing this over the VPN.

GeoServer has been restarted, but the following error is logged:

```
2020-07-22 19:18:14,326 ERROR [map.png] - Failed to encode the PNG
ar.com.hjg.pngj.PngjOutputException: org.geoserver.ows.ClientStreamAbortedException
        at ar.com.hjg.pngj.PngHelperInternal.writeBytes(PngHelperInternal.java:196)
        at ar.com.hjg.pngj.chunks.ChunkRaw.writeChunk(ChunkRaw.java:97)
        at ar.com.hjg.pngj.PngIDatChunkOutputStream.flushBuffer(PngIDatChunkOutputStream.java:28)
        at ar.com.hjg.pngj.ProgressiveOutputStream.checkFlushBuffer(ProgressiveOutputStream.java:65)
        at ar.com.hjg.pngj.ProgressiveOutputStream.flush(ProgressiveOutputStream.java:28)
        at ar.com.hjg.pngj.PngWriter.end(PngWriter.java:400)
        at it.geosolutions.imageio.plugins.png.PNGWriter.writePNG(PNGWriter.java:92)
        at org.geoserver.wms.map.png.PNGJWriter.writePNG(PNGJWriter.java:51)
        at org.geoserver.wms.map.PNGMapResponse.formatImageOutputStream(PNGMapResponse.java:104)
        at org.geoserver.wms.map.RenderedImageMapResponse.write(RenderedImageMapResponse.java:123)
        at org.geoserver.ows.Dispatcher.response(Dispatcher.java:1009)
```

Redeploying `pulmap` did restore service, but I receive a different error message when attempting to download derivatives:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88238976-1c73f480-cc51-11ea-8992-6f6e15e6db83.png)

This is being triggered by the following error on GeoServer:

```
abstractQueryExpression[0]:
        typeNames[0] = {http://restricted-figgy}p-c3618d35-d02a-4e84-bc57-cefe10d90934
        srsName = EPSG:4326
2020-07-22 19:27:54,686 INFO [wfs.json] - about to encode JSON
2020-07-22 19:27:58,037 ERROR [geoserver.ows] -
org.geoserver.platform.ServiceException: This request used more time than allowed and has been forcefully stopped. Max rendering time is 60.0s
        at org.geoserver.wms.map.RenderedImageMapOutputFormat.produceMap(RenderedImageMapOutputFormat.java:576)
        at org.geoserver.wms.map.RenderedImageMapOutputFormat.produceMap(RenderedImageMapOutputFormat.java:276)
        at org.geoserver.wms.map.RenderedImageMapOutputFormat.produceMap(RenderedImageMapOutputFormat.java:139)
```

There are also additional error messages which I keep receiving in the GeoServer logs:

```
2020-07-22 19:45:28,206 INFO [geoserver.gwc] - Error dispatching tile request to GeoServer
org.geowebcache.GeoWebCacheException: Problem communicating with GeoServer
```
Nothing seems invalid with the Figgy Resource: https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog/6f14c1a5-34d1-4fc3-b8e7-f481cf03d195

After several attempts to restart GeoServer, I could not manage to connect to the server from lib-adc1:

```
pulsys@lib-adc1:~$ curl -I http://libserv21.princeton.edu:8080/
```

Please note that Tomcat was running on libserv21:

```
pulsys@libserv21:/var/log/tomcat8$ sudo systemctl status tomcat8.service
● tomcat8.service - LSB: Start Tomcat.
   Loaded: loaded (/etc/init.d/tomcat8; bad; vendor preset: enabled)
   Active: active (running) since Wed 2020-07-22 20:54:45 EDT; 2min 11s ago
     Docs: man:systemd-sysv-generator(8)
  Process: 103488 ExecStop=/etc/init.d/tomcat8 stop (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)

    Tasks: 105
   Memory: 1.2G
      CPU: 3min 17.257s
   CGroup: /system.slice/tomcat8.service
           └─103553 /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/bin/java -Djava.util.logging.config.file=/var/lib/tomcat8/conf/logging.properties -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManage
Jul 22 20:54:40 libserv21 systemd[1]: Starting LSB: Start Tomcat....
Jul 22 20:54:40 libserv21 tomcat8[103528]:  * Starting Tomcat servlet engine tomcat8
Jul 22 20:54:45 libserv21 tomcat8[103528]:    ...done.
Jul 22 20:54:45 libserv21 systemd[1]: Started LSB: Start Tomcat..
```

...and that the GeoServer app was running:
```
22-Jul-2020 20:54:47.532 WARNING [localhost-startStop-1] org.geoserver.platform.GeoServerExtensions.checkContext Extension lookup 'XStreamPersisterInitializer', but ApplicationContext is unset.
22-Jul-2020 20:54:47.533 WARNING [localhost-startStop-1] org.geoserver.platform.GeoServerExtensions.checkContext Extension lookup 'ExtensionFilter', but ApplicationContext is unset.

22-Jul-2020 20:54:48.685 WARNING [localhost-startStop-1] org.geoserver.platform.GeoServerExtensions.checkContext Extension lookup 'GeoServerSecurityProvider', but ApplicationContext is unset.
22-Jul-2020 20:54:48.685 WARNING [localhost-startStop-1] org.geoserver.platform.GeoServerExtensions.checkContext Extension lookup 'ExtensionFilter', but ApplicationContext is unset.
22-Jul-2020 20:54:48.685 WARNING [localhost-startStop-1] org.geoserver.platform.GeoServerExtensions.checkContext Extension lookup 'ExtensionProvider', but ApplicationContext is unset.
22-Jul-2020 20:54:48.686 WARNING [localhost-startStop-1] org.geoserver.platform.GeoServerExtensions.checkContext Extension lookup 'ExtensionFilter', but ApplicationContext is unset.
```

The `Max rendering time (s)` has been increased from 60s to 6000s:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88246147-a7f88000-cc67-11ea-9354-413812849cd7.png)

Unfortunately, this does not seem to have fully resolved the issue, as the `Faraday` client seems to just time out:

```
2020-07-22 21:59:40,263 INFO [geoserver.wfs] -
Request: getFeature
    service = wfs
    version = 2.0.0
    baseUrl = http://geoserver-prod:80/geoserver/
    outputFormat = SHAPE-ZIP
    resolve = none
    resolveDepth = *
    resolveTimeout = 300
    resultType = results
    abstractQueryExpressionGroup[0] = wfs:abstractQueryExpression=net.opengis.wfs20.impl.QueryTypeImpl@6cf31b98 (handle: null) (abstractProjectionClause: null, abstractSelectionClause: null, abstractSortingClause: null, aliases: null, typeNames: [{http://restricted-figgy}p-c3618d35-d02a-4e84-bc57-cefe10d90934]) (featureVersion: null, srsName: EPSG:4326, filter: null, propertyNames: null, sortBy: null)
    abstractQueryExpression[0]:
        typeNames[0] = {http://restricted-figgy}p-c3618d35-d02a-4e84-bc57-cefe10d90934
        srsName = EPSG:4326

2020-07-22 22:00:51,155 INFO [geoserver.servlets] - OutputStream was successfully aborted.
```

As of 09:44 EDT, GeoServer does seem to be serving vector datasets for Princeton Documents:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88293591-32250080-ccc9-11ea-835e-9a7662603918.png)

The KMZ derivatives now seem to be generating:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88294175-efaff380-ccc9-11ea-961f-f29c5476df49.png)

The GeoJSON download is functioning properly as well, however the Shapefile derivative is still failing for this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88295209-1a4e7c00-cccb-11ea-8c32-368cfb7705f4.png)
Attempting to manually place a Shapefile into the `/tmp/cache/downloads` directory does *not* serve the file from this interface.
The correct directory is `/opt/pulmap/shared/maplab/pulmap/downloads`, I am uploading the file now.

Uploading the Shapefile manually restored downloads for this derivative:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1443986/88301750-04dd5000-ccd3-11ea-8816-4b048ae47d66.png)

pulmap.title: Ensuring that "vector" icons are overridden with "polygon"

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/32282111/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/32282111)

Coverage remained the same at 100.0% when pulling **b205a7823564973db9d3ca2ccceab626adff0ffa on issues-844-jrgriffiniii-vector-icon** into **389e2c951973dc3a6cc5a779a84058757e2eb2f5 on master**.
This was triggered again by my last redeployment on 07/23/20 at 19:19 EDT (please see https://faq.library.princeton.edu/admin/ticket?qid=5482023)
This was not fixed by redeploying the application to the production environment.

I cannot locate this `vector.svg` icon anywhere in the precompiled assets within the production environment for pulmap, geoblacklight, or blacklight. I'm going to proceed with error handling for this.
The item is permanently located in "sa" but is temporarily in "sar". Something related to a mismatch there is likely the root cause.
